1.text: Book of the generation of Jesus Christ, Son of David, Son of Abraham.

2.text: Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob begat Juda and his brethren;

3.text: and Juda begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom, and Esrom begat Aram,

4.text: and Aram begat Aminadab, and Aminadab begat Naasson, and Naasson begat Salmon,

5.text: and Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse,

6.text: and Jesse begat David the king. And David begat Solomon, of her [that had been the wife] of Urias;

7.text: and Solomon begat Roboam, and Roboam begat Abia, and Abia begat Asa,

8.text: and Asa begat Josaphat, and Josaphat begat Joram, and Joram begat Ozias,

9.text: and Ozias begat Joatham, and Joatham begat Achaz, and Achaz begat Ezekias,

10.text: and Ezekias begat Manasses, and Manasses begat Amon, and Amon begat Josias,

11.text: and Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, at the time of the carrying away of Babylon.

12.text: And after the carrying away of Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel, and Salathiel begat Zorobabel,

13.text: and Zorobabel begat Abiud, and Abiud begat Eliakim, and Eliakim begat Azor,

14.text: and Azor begat Sadoc, and Sadoc begat Achim, and Achim begat Eliud,

15.text: and Eliud begat Eliazar, and Eliazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob,

16.text: and Jacob begat Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

17.text: All the generations, therefore, from Abraham to David [were] fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away of Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the carrying away of Babylon unto the Christ, fourteen generations.

18.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: His mother, Mary, that is, having been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together, she was found to be with child of [the] Holy Spirit.

19.text: But Joseph, her husband, being [a] righteous [man], and unwilling to expose her publicly, purposed to have put her away secretly;

20.text: but while he pondered on these things, behold, an angel of [the] Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, Joseph, son of David, fear not to take to [thee] Mary, thy wife, for that which is begotten in her is of [the] Holy Spirit.

21.text: And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus, for he shall save his people from their sins.

22.text: Now all this came to pass that that might be fulfilled which was spoken by [the] Lord, through the prophet, saying,

23.text: Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which is, being interpreted, ‘God with us.’

24.text: But Joseph, having awoke up from his sleep, did as the angel of [the] Lord had enjoined him, and took to [him] his wife,

25.text: and knew her not until she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name Jesus.
